dcterms:creator: J. Devlin
M.-W. Chang
K. Lee
K. Toutanova
dcterms:description: A dataset of handwritten digits consisting of 60,000 training images and 10,000 testing images, commonly used for training various image processing systems.
dcterms:title: MNIST

dcterms:description: A synthetic dataset generated from a Gaussian distribution, used to analyze the performance of neural networks on linearly separable data.
dcterms:title: Gaussian data

dcterms:description: A variant of the MNIST dataset where the images are binarized, used to study the effects of binary representations on neural network training.
dcterms:title: Binary MNIST

dcterms:description: A dataset consisting of points that can be separated by a linear boundary, used to evaluate the performance of neural networks in learning simple patterns.
dcterms:title: Linearly separable data

dcterms:description: A dataset consisting of two Gaussian distributions that are antipodal to each other, used to study the clustering behavior of neural networks.
dcterms:title: Antipodal Gaussians
